intro: Heliotropium cinereum, commonly known as silver heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the late spring and summer. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its hairy stems and leaves.
